Only one noteworthy issue here.  Otherwise, looks pretty good.

---

Reviewed 24 of 24 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed, 3 unresolved discussions (waiting on @apolcyn, @dgquintas, @AspirinSJL, and @nicolasnoble)

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.cc, line 283 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15797#-LGziqCb9UgPNZzlWOJ3:-LGziqCb9UgPNZzlWOJ4:b-gvo7s5) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/cf68ab195bb04fee80826b4348bf5631fa3d0739/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.cc#L283)):*
> ```cpp
>       for (struct ares_srv_reply* srv_it = reply; srv_it != nullptr;
>            srv_it = srv_it->next) {
>         // TODO: selectively query based on ipv4/ipv6 support
> ```

I'd prefer not to add this overhead unless necessary.  How about having `grpc_ipv6_loopback_available()` return true on Windows?  (Or, if that function is used in other places where it should continue to return false, then maybe add a wrapper function specifically for c-ares that returns true on Windows.)

---

*[src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.cc, line 454 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15797#-LGzj61r2GnM7DtQ7QCF:-LGzj61r2GnM7DtQ7QCG:brhumzt) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/cf68ab195bb04fee80826b4348bf5631fa3d0739/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.cc#L454)):*
> ```cpp
>   }
>   r->pending_queries = 1;
>   // TODO: selectively query based on ipv4/ipv6 support
> ```

Same here.

---

*[third_party/address_sorting/address_sorting_windows.c, line 52 at r1](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15797#-LGzjNqJB1yK-NV4s-bl:-LGzjNqJB1yK-NV4s-bm:b-svyeh9) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/cf68ab195bb04fee80826b4348bf5631fa3d0739/third_party/address_sorting/address_sorting_windows.c#L52)):*
> ```C
> #include <sys/types.h>
> 
> static bool windows_source_addr_factory_get_source_addr(
> ```

@nicolasnoble should review this file.  I don't know the Windows API well enough to do so myself.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io/reviews/grpc/grpc/15797#-:-LGzjyp1AldAkso3SB8d:bqi4z8e)*
